block.comment: This block creates a list of booleans. The size determines how many booleans are in the list.
This block sets up the let matrix.

The setup block runs after all library blocks. It only runs once.
Use a setup block initialize variables in code.
This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.
This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.
This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.

This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.
This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.
This block puts a boolean into the list. The position determines where in the list the boolean will be. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.

The loop block runs on repeat until your Arduino loses power. It runs right after your setup block if you have one.
If you are using the simulator, you can control how many times it repeats.

A for "count with block" creates a loop where it will stop looping once the variable has reached the "to" point. The best way to learn this block is to drag it out and play around with its values in the simulator.

A for "count with block" creates a loop where it will stop looping once the variable has reached the "to" point. The best way to learn this block is to drag it out and play around with its values in the simulator.
It checks a condition using the if statement, executes a block of code if the condition is true, and otherwise executes the code inside the block when the condition is false.
This block gets a boolean from the list. The position determines where in the list you are getting the boolean. The first boolean in the list starts at position 1.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.

Turns or off one led on the led matrix.
The higher the number for the column, the more right the led will be. The higher the number for the row, the lower the will be.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.

Turns or off one led on the led matrix.
The higher the number for the column, the more right the led will be. The higher the number for the row, the lower the will be.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.
This block gets the value that the variable is storing. This variable store a number.
Wait for the given/defined seconds.
